sub_topic: Calculation of coefficient of performance of a heat pump
message_1: A heat pump operates at a temperature difference of 30Â°C and has a power input of 2 kW. If the heat output of the heat pump is 8 kW, what is the coefficient of performance of the heat pump?
message_2:
The coefficient of performance (COP) of a heat pump is the ratio of the heat output to the power input. In this case, the heat output is 8 kW, and the power input is 2 kW. To find the COP, we can use the following formula:

COP = Heat Output / Power Input

Plugging in the given values:

COP = 8 kW / 2 kW

COP = 4

So, the coefficient of performance of the heat pump is 4.
